titles.title: A joint resolution to recognize the Disabled American Veterans Vietnam Veterans National Memorial as a memorial of national significance.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred to Subcommittee on Census and Population.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Census and Population Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 415.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 1/21/1987--Introduced. Recognizes the Disabled American Veterans Vietnam Veterans National Memorial near Eagle Nest, New Mexico, as a memorial of national significance. Requests the President to issue a proclamation commemorating the occasion of this recognition.
